CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1953, page 3, reads: "First Cancer Fund Check - Mrs. Nellie West of Duff Street is shown as she presents the first check for $100 in Cancer Fund Drive of 1953 in the Upper Hill District recently. Mrs. Robert E. (Pappy) Williams, neighborhood chairman, working under Mrs. Ella Ruffin, area chairman, is shown receiving the check, while Mrs. Williams' little daughter Rosalyn, pins a 'Cancer Drive' button on Mrs. West. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Two women and a girl, including Mrs. Williams standing on left, holding check for the 1953 Cancer Fund Drive and Rosalyn Williams pinning a button on Nellie West, gathered around desk with ashtray in wood paneled office interior
